com.mycompany.a1

Class GameWorld

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mycompany.a1.GameWorld

  • public class GameWorld
extends java.lang.Object
    GameWorld will create instances of all the game objects needed to populate the game world
    Author:
    Alexander Alestra

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameWorld() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void accelerate()
      This method will accelerate the ant forward until it hits its max It will go through the array to find the ant then call accelerate in ant
      void addGameObjects()
      This method will initialize how many of each object is required to populate the world at a bare minimum but can add more wih random It uses for loops to go through how many of each game object is chosen to spawn At the end the ant will be spawned
      void brake()
      Brake method will slow down the ant Similar to accalerate
      void collisionFoodStation()
      Collision with a food station will check to see the first available food station it will then check to see if the station has already been used if it hasn't the ant will get more food and the station will change color
      void collisionSpider()
      Collision with spider will force the ant to take damage It first searches for the ant then checks to see if it has zero life level then it will check to see if the amount of lives not zero This will force the ant to respawn from the last flag reached The ladder will force a game over If the ant has plenty of health level then it will reduce the health update the max speed it can go then change the color of the ant
      void collisonFlag(int c)
      Collsion with the flag will check if the flag is indeed next next it will update the last reached flag If it is not then it will say yyou passed it If the flag is equal to the last flag then the ant won
      void exit()
      Will exit game
      void gameTick()
      Game tick is will update the movement of the spider while also checking the boundary Then it will check the food level of the ant and boundary if the ant has run out of food it will reset to the last reached flag Else it will move the ant and remove some food level
      int getTime()
      Getter for time
      void init()
      init will initialize the variables as well as call addGameObjects
      void printCurrent()
      This will print the current life, time, last flag reached, food level, and current health
      void printMap()
      Prints the string of all the concrete classes in the array
      void turnLeftAnt()
      Turn left will for the ant to turn 5 degrees to the left
      void turnRightAnt()
      Turn right will for the ant to turn 5 degrees to the right

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • addGameObjects

        public void addGameObjects()
        This method will initialize how many of each object is required to populate the world at a bare minimum but can add more wih random It uses for loops to go through how many of each game object is chosen to spawn At the end the ant will be spawned

      • accelerate

        public void accelerate()
        This method will accelerate the ant forward until it hits its max It will go through the array to find the ant then call accelerate in ant

      • brake

        public void brake()
        Brake method will slow down the ant Similar to accalerate

      • turnLeftAnt

        public void turnLeftAnt()
        Turn left will for the ant to turn 5 degrees to the left

      • turnRightAnt

        public void turnRightAnt()
        Turn right will for the ant to turn 5 degrees to the right

      • collisionSpider

        public void collisionSpider()
        Collision with spider will force the ant to take damage It first searches for the ant then checks to see if it has zero life level then it will check to see if the amount of lives not zero This will force the ant to respawn from the last flag reached The ladder will force a game over If the ant has plenty of health level then it will reduce the health update the max speed it can go then change the color of the ant

      • collisionFoodStation

        public void collisionFoodStation()
        Collision with a food station will check to see the first available food station it will then check to see if the station has already been used if it hasn't the ant will get more food and the station will change color

      • collisonFlag

        public void collisonFlag(int c)
        Collsion with the flag will check if the flag is indeed next next it will update the last reached flag If it is not then it will say yyou passed it If the flag is equal to the last flag then the ant won
        Parameters:
        c - is the next flag in the array that the ant has collided with

      • gameTick

        public void gameTick()
        Game tick is will update the movement of the spider while also checking the boundary Then it will check the food level of the ant and boundary if the ant has run out of food it will reset to the last reached flag Else it will move the ant and remove some food level

      • printMap

        public void printMap()
        Prints the string of all the concrete classes in the array

      • printCurrent

        public void printCurrent()
        This will print the current life, time, last flag reached, food level, and current health

        public int getTime()
        Getter for time
        Returns:

        public void exit()
        Will exit game
